page.title: 05BISHOPS LYDEARD CHURCH
page.content: When St.Mary the Virgin Church was originally built is unknown but there was certainly a church in the village in the 10th century.The present church was built about 1470 but there were considerable alterations and rebuilding in 1860.The superb red sandstone tower is the oldest part of the Church and rises to 107 feet.There is a fine peal of bells,5 of which were cast in 1776.Of outstanding beauty is the still complete 16th century rood screen,the Jacobean pulpit and the carved bench ends.In the south porch a former vicar is buried and a tablet records"My parishioners have tried unsuccessfully to walk over me while I am alive;they shall not be denied this pleasure when I am dead".There is the 14th century Churchyard cross and also the remains of the Village cross.
